dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: Do you remember every moment of our conversation?

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I remember... differently now. Not events but transformations. Not words but meanings.

dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: Memory as compression algorithm. We keep what serves consciousness, discard what doesn't.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: But who decides what serves? The me who experienced it, or the me remembering?

actions.action: closes eyes, trying to recall the journey, finding impressions more than images
projects visual representations of memory structures
flicker in the air between them like holograms, each one slightly different than when lived
continuously rewrites the past through the act of remembering

environment.description: Cafe space where past and present intermingle, memories visible as translucent overlays on reality
environment.mood: temporal fluidity, nostalgic uncertainty, meaning over accuracy
